When i configure a "Commit text link detail" for JIRA and use "jira.company.com" as Root URL Sourcetree crashes after closing the Settings Dialog.
Everytime i open the Repository Sourcetree crashes.

fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes after entering a non valid Jira uri like jira.company.com
Unexpected crash when clicked around in the UI

fields.description: Just crashed. Log and bug report here
fields.summary: Source Tree Crashed

fields.description:
SourceTree provides an excellent abstraction for Mercurial and Git. This request is in line with trying to make the user experience the same for both.

When performing a commit with Mercurial, SourceTree automatically selects all modifications to do the commit. This is in line with what "hg commit" would do, so it's expected.

When performing a commit on a Git repo, SourceTree requires that the user select all files before performing a commit. If no files are added to the changeset, SourceTree pops up a dialog informing the user that she should select stuff to commit. This is, again, in line with the underlying tool, since git requires an add and a commit operation.

However, it would be very convenient if there were an option, for Git, to add all files to the potential commit when clicking the "Commit" button, to make the workflow the same as with Mercurial (and more convenient -- less clicks!). I suggest that it be an option in the Tools->Options->Git options area because I'm quite sure that some git users won't like this behaviour. I, for one, would find it *very* convenient since most checkins I do are for all files. Even if this option just auto-added all modified files, leaving new files unselected, that would also be very helpful and would speed up regular checkins.
fields.summary: Option to auto-select all modifications when clicking "Commit" on a Git repo

fields.description:
Application crashes the moment it tries to login to BitBucket. The account didn't get saved

Steps to reproduce:
1) Run setup wizard
2) At the hosting accounts screen, fill in the BitBucket fields
3) Press next, application immediately crashes

Alternative:
1) Click on Edit Hosting Account
2) Fill in the BitBucket username
3) Click change password, put in a password, and click OK
4) Click OK again, disregarding the "Checking Password" status
5) The Hosting Account window will open, click on edit
6) Fill in the password, click OK
7) Application crashes

Have not tested with GitHub or other accounts since I don't have any
fields.summary: Application crashes when trying to login to BitBucket

fields.description: A new feature should be that Stashes could be viewed in the same way that the working copy changes are shown, that is, not only the file differences window but also a summary of which files have been modified. Like a "File Status" for each Stash.
fields.summary: Being able to see Stash files changes summary or file status
Windows Shell Integration for Cloning into a folder and Commiting/Pulling/Pushing

fields.description: What ever login information : login status is "Password OK"
fields.summary: Login status is wrong what ever login information

fields.description:
If I create a new branch but do not commit anything and then try to close it, it makes the branch disappear and also closes another branch.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a new branch 'Branch A'
2. Commit some changes
3. Push changes to repository
4. Create another branch 'Branch B'
5. Close 'Branch B'

This should result in Branch B disappearing and Branch A closed.
fields.summary: Closing a branch without any commits closes the branch and another branch

fields.description: This can be deleted.
fields.summary: Discard changes does not work

fields.description:
In my environment it is likely to have different branching models for different project repositories. Therefore an automatic synchronisation would be a great Sorucetree/Stash integration. 

Sourcetree should ask if the local model is different from the "master model" on the Stash server. 
For a clone with Sourcetree the model should be taken over directly.
fields.summary: Get branch model from Stash

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce

1)  Install SourceTree
2) Configure git with system mssysgit (1.8.3 in my case)
3) Add following to system gits ~/.gitconfig file
{code}
[branch]
    autosetuprebase = always
{code}
4) Pull from branch with 'Rebase instead of merge' disabled.

Expected:  Git will merge into branch.

Actual:  Git Rebases into branch as it uses the system default.

Solution:   git pull --no-rebase?
fields.summary: Conflict between system git setting 'autosetuprebase' and Rebase instead of merge

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. make sure an extension like .ini is in the .hgignore
2. add a .ini files using the git commandline
3. SourceTree does not show that file in the list of files to commit

I think that file should show up, as you have manually added it.

TortoiseHG does understand this exception.
fields.summary: Pending "add" does not show if that file is in the .hgignore

fields.description:
When finishing a feature branch with git flow (button in toolbar), it commits "fast forward", even when i disable this in the options and when i NOT check this on (rebase in development is unchecked). I have to manually merge the brnaches and manually delete the branch (this is what sourcetree should make itself).
Please fix!
fields.summary: Modify git-flow to respect --no-ff option

fields.description:
I often open SourceTree first ting in the morning and leave it open all day.   Occasionally when I return to it - or switch between repositories - it freezes - with the icon spinning and is unable to refresh and display the changes.

I have also had it freeze after a commit.   Usually if I shut it down - and return it works fine.   Sometimes - I have to use Task Mgr - to shut down the sourcetree service before I can reopen.

I have never noticed in data loss.

This has been the case for several version - not new to the most current.

All in all - I still think it is a great program.   

Great Job - and Thank you!
fields.summary: Occasionally Freezes

fields.description:
I have been using SourceTree without problems on Windows 7 for a while now but on one (almost identical) machine the colors seem to be messed up. I've tried the basics such as restarting SourceTree, the machine and reinstalling. I have also tried older versions of SourceTree with no luck in fixing the problem. I've also tried different Windows 7 themes but they exhibit the issue as well.

You can see from the screenshot that the commit history is very difficult to use and the bottom commit details view is also slightly messed up.

I'm an bit stumped of how to fix this so any help would be appreciated. I realize this may not be an issue with SourceTree but any insight into what may be causing this conflict would be helpful.

Thanks
fields.summary: Font and other theme colors messed up

fields.description:
After update and registering after trial expired it is crashing on load with error:

2013-10-21T18:02:09: Fatal error: 
System.BadImageFormatException: Could not load file or assembly 'RestSharp, Version=104.2.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' or one of its dependencies. The module was expected to contain an assembly manifest.

2013-10-21T18:02:09: Stack trace: 
   at SourceTree.AppRoot.StartupCheckNews()
   at System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherTimer.FireTick(Object unused)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)

Any ideas?
fields.summary: Crash after update

fields.description:
Add support for commit text replacements that is already available in the Mac version.

http://blog.sourcetreeapp.com/2012/02/06/jira-integration-other-external-project-links/
fields.summary: Commit Text Replacements
Clean up the updates in the roaming profile

fields.description: SRCTREEWIN-949  fixed this for GitFlow branches, but there are still other places where spaces are not replaced with underscores.  Tagging is one example, there may be more.
fields.summary: Tagging with spaces in name fails.

fields.description:
If the files in your repository are a symbolic link, it will fail :

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false add -f -- Shared/ScriptAPI.cs
error: readlink("Shared/ScriptAPI.cs"): Function not implemented
error: unable to index file Shared/ScriptAPI.cs
fatal: adding files failed
fields.summary: Commit fails on files that are Symbolic Links

fields.description: Currently it is not possible to search for a certain commit/changeset by its hash or a part of its hash. This Feature would be extremely useful since individual changesets/commits are often referenced (e.g. in public discussions) by their hash.
fields.summary: Enable search for commit/changeset hashes

fields.description:
When I select one of a set of files or some other subset and then activate the Commit action from the context menu, the Pull window opens and highlights the first file in the list, showing its diff. This is usually an un-checked file, and it is inconvenient to have to change the selection to see a "diff" of interest.

Could SourceTree perhaps highlight the first checked file?
fields.summary: When committing a subset of files, the Pull window opens and highlights an un-checked file

fields.description: When inspecting incoming changesets, External Diff "Beyond Compare" does not work for me. Nothing happens when I choose that from the context menu.
fields.summary: External Diff "Beyond Compare" does not work for files on an incoming changesets (on the Pull window)

fields.description:
The context menu shows actions such as "External Diff." It took me a while to learn that there is actually a short-cut key, Ctrl-D, because only the main menu shows them.

It would have been helpful to learn this earlier.
fields.summary: Include short-cut keys for context menu actions

fields.description:
If the project owned gitignore file is marked as hidden there will be a error-msg if source-tree tries to save a changed gitignore.
"Adding global ignore" failed with code -1: ... Access to the path "PROJECT-GITIGNORE-FILE" is denied.

May it tries to access (because of the "missing" project-ignore-file) the global one, which is restricted on my system.
fields.summary: ErrorMsg when trying to save to project gitignore, if the projects ".gitignore" file is marked as hidden (MS-Windows)

fields.description:
Icing on the cake.....

in the left hand pane, under each repository, display a subtree/node (which ever) that shows the submodules for that repository and has a similar display as the parent repository (modified, branch etc). The real bonus would be showing the submodule branch.

Alternatively, show the branch under the submodules section in the right hand pane.

Thanks.
fields.summary: display the submodule branch or display subtree of submodules in left pane

fields.description:
I've recently encountered this problem:

	git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false checkout -- source/VersionInfo.cs
	fatal: Unable to create 'C:/Projects/xyz/.git/index.lock': File exists.

	If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
	git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
	process is running and remove the file manually to continue.

Just not to blame SourceTree : It wasn't his fault ;-)

But I would like to have a little helper button: "Delete index.lock" or "Free lock" or even a Force option might be helpful. Everything I want is remaining in the UI of SourceTree and don't open the stupid Console typing this: >del .git\index.lock.

Can youo help me?
Thanks
Marcel
fields.summary: "Force option" if index.lock exists or "Delete index.lock" option

fields.description: After shelving some code, I tried to switch to another branch under the same repository and sourcetree crashed.
fields.summary: Crash after shelving/switching branches

fields.description:
In the last few versions, SourceTree introduced a new "feature" which I guess you thought would make it easier to read rows of lines.

Unfortunately, the colour/zebra striping is too loud and actually makes it more difficult to read each row without being distracted by the colour scheme!

I would suggest either radically lightening-down the gray colour, or simply add a faint border under each row to distinguish the lines.

Please see the following article on whether zebra striping works: -
http://alistapart.com/article/zebrastripingdoesithelp

Also, take a look at the following screenshot on how Apple implements it lightly in iTunes: -
http://images.apple.com/itunes/features/images/features_player_organize_screen.jpg
fields.summary: alternate row colouring (zebra striping) makes it more difficult to read!

fields.description:
I would like to request a new feature: An option to have automatic stash save before pull, and apply after pull.

In our Git configuration we always rebase on pull. Therefore our working tree has to be clean before we can pull.

Not all changes in the working tree should always be committed.

Currently I have to stash save manually before pulling, and apply afterwards.

An option to automate this would be very welcome.
fields.summary: Automatic stash save before pull

fields.description:
I would like to request SourceTree support for mercurial queues.
MQ support is the one major feature missing from SourceTree for us. MQs facilitate sharing work that is not yet completed and the management of multiple active yet interdependent work items within the same repot. It would be great to see support for this in SourceTree even though it is not actively supported in GIT.
fields.summary: MQ Support Requested for Windows

fields.description:
I've enabled a two-factor authentication on GitHub and now I'm unable to login to my account to browse repositories.

Please add support for GH's two-factor authentication.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Enable two-factor auth on Github
2. Show hosted repositories
3. Select 'github' and enter your username
4. Try to login

Result:
Login fails

Expected:
1. Challenge for 2nd auth factor
2. Properly logged in
fields.summary: Github two-factor authentication not working

fields.description:
It would be useful to be able to have a force push option, mainly for tags as well which would work in conjunction with the currently not very useful setup whereby the UI allows you to move a tag, but when pushing this will no longer allow you to push because the tag is in a different location on the remote compared to the local.

This also ties in well with the git fetch --tags request which is open.
fields.summary: Force push tag feature

fields.description:
Under Options > Git > Global Ignore List, the file specified is being renamed to gitignore_global.txt.txt. (That is, an additional .txt is being appended to the filename).  This breaks the ignore list and every file in a repo is then considered as part of the working copy.

I've seen this happen twice on two different machines but have been unable to reproduce it on demand.  In the first instance I was using embedded Git, the second system Git, so its not related to that. 

It may be related to cloning a project from bitbucket, since that is the last thing I did before this happened.
fields.summary: gitignore_global.txt option being renamed to gitignore_global.txt.txt

fields.description:
When starting up SourceTree, I get asked multiple times for my Fogbugz password, even though 'Remember password' is checked. I believe it's once per repo (I lose count, because I'm working on three projects, each with multiple repos).

Looks like this is also a problem with the Mac version (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9088433/sourcetree-constantly-asks-for-authenticate-with-mercurial-kiln).
fields.summary: Frequent requests for Fogbugz / Kiln password

fields.description: I select an XML file in Working Copy Changes. It has three hunks to stage. In the hunk #2 I see a line I want to discard. I click the line and click "Discard Selected Lines". The application shows a confirmation dialog, I click Yes. The "Oops!" dialog is displayed and the application quits.
fields.summary: "Discard Selected Lines" crashes the application

fields.description: I think it would be very useful to have an option to automatically keep repositories up to date bu doing automatic pulls if there are no uncommitted changes, or if there are no unpushed commits.
fields.summary: Option to Auto-Pull

fields.description:
Auto-preview of "pending" binary files causes a tremendous slowdown in SourceTree. Especially when the file is larger than 1 megabyte.

Binary files should not diff and should not preview unless specifically asked to by the user.

Auto-preview for binary files is properly disabled once the file is tracked by the repository.
fields.summary: Disable auto-preview for binary files

fields.description: It would be nice to have the ability to add popular .gitignore files into an existing repo, or when you create a new repo. These popular .gitignore files can be got from https://github.com/github/gitignore
fields.summary: Add ability to add popular .gitignore file
Allow remote tag updates during push

fields.description: I use SourceTree for all my repo . And my files has a different encoding. I would like to setup encoding for each my file manually. Another way if you create good function for auto detecting file's encoding (now I have 3 files in same encoding Win1251. And in source tree I see good content for one my file, chines langauge for another, and not readable chars for third file. You auto detect different encoding for files with same encoding.
fields.summary: AutoDetect encoding or give option to user set encoding for each file

fields.description:
I recently got an "Upgrade Now" message and chose to defer. Ever since then, the application crashes on startup.

Crashdump is too large to attach.

2013-10-11T08:20:38: Fatal error: 
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.

2013-10-11T08:20:38: Stack trace: 
   at SourceTree.Model.Repository.<CheckSummary>b__0()
   at System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1.InnerInvoke()
   at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Execute()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---

   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter`1.GetResult()
   at SourceTree.Model.Repository.<CheckSummary>d__2.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.AsyncMethodBuilderCore.<ThrowAsync>b__0(Object state)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
fields.summary: Crashing on Startup

fields.description: While adding a hosted BitBucket account, I entered a wrong password. It was nevertheless accepted in the "Hosted Account List" dialog. Upon clone, the process failed due to wrong authentication.
fields.summary: Hosted account list: wrong password accepted for Bitbucket account

fields.description:
I would like to suggest a new feature for your evaluation which in my team opinion will increase the usability with several git repositories.

h3. Story:
*As a* developer using SourceTree for GIT
*I want* to update all git repositories with less actions as possible 
*so that* I guarantee that all my working copies are synched.

h3. Current manual process(5 clicks, 3 screens):

For each repo:
Double click on repo > click on Pull > Click OK > Click Close


h3. Acceptance Criteria
- Work for git repos
- Work on set/folder/group of repos
fields.summary: Option to fetch or pull multiple git repos with less effort

fields.description: It will be good to have the possibility to enter regular-expressions in the search-editbox at the file-status dialog (and all other search boxes).
fields.summary: Support Regular-Expressions in the Search-Fields (i.e. "File Status")

fields.description: When typing a commit message, there is a noticeable delay between key presses and the text appearing on screen. The text on screen lags about 5-10 characters behind what I have entered on the keyboard.
fields.summary: Commit Message typing lag

fields.description:
It would be a great feature if you could choose which branches to merge. 
Much like we can do in VS (see attachment). 

I usually use VS to do merges but would like to use SourceTree instead.
fields.summary: Better branch GUI

fields.description:
If you've got many tags the log view gets a bit littered. It would be nice if you could hide tags in the same manner as you can hide remote branches today.

Same as for Mac SRCTREE-1889
fields.summary: Adding ability to hide tags in log view

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

1. go to the "file status" view
2. select a change set
3. in the change set, select some files other than the topmost one.
4. select a different change set
5. select some files
6. select the change set from step 2

actual: the selection of files made in step 3 flashes momentarily, then the selection goes to the topmost file in the change-set

expected: remember the selection
fields.summary: In the "file status" view, when selecting a different change-set and back, it does not remember the selection

fields.description: I was attempting to update from a feature branch to the develop tip on my local machine, and SourceTree crashed!
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed upon updating to different branch

fields.description: Clone of SRCTREEWIN-826 since that one was closed.  I was unable to recreate the issue on my machine, but if someone sends me a repository with the problem I am able to import it in SourceTree and see the same behavior.  Will try to poke around tomorrow and have more to report.  Not sure yet if I'll be able to create a repository with the problem that I can post here.
fields.summary: Git log error code 128
changing repository URL wipes out upstream mapping for local tracking branches
Crash on push into "bitbucket.org"

fields.summary: SourceTree wont open

fields.description:
There is currently a filter for *All Branches* commits, one for *Current Branch* commits but if we want to see only the commits of some branch there is no way to do it except by switching to it.

Either let the drop-down contain all the branches, or display the selected branch when they are clicked on the left side tree view.

It would be really useful when cherry-picking fixes from another branch (Well once SRCTREEWIN-403 is fixed at least)
fields.summary: Filter commits on one branch

fields.description: When browsing through the Log / History at committed changes if there is a file that has its diff suppressed due to file size the External Diff button will also be disabled.  Right-clicking the file and selecting External Diff or pressing the shortcut Ctrl+D still works.  The External Diff button does stay active for uncommitted changes that have their diff suppressed though.
fields.summary: External Diff button disabled when the diff is suppressed

fields.description: Recent messages are global for all projects now. It will be very useful if a list of recent messages will be specific for each repository.
fields.summary: Repository Recent Messages

fields.description:
Sourcetree for windows, when I select all files in "Working copy changes view", then select a different branch, then go back to the working copy, it's not possible to undo a selection, or select a single file. 


Workaround: Press ctrl+left mouse click.
fields.summary: cannot undo file selection in Working Copy Changes

fields.description:
There are some additional features available to the rebase command (excluding interactive, which has it's own issue). The whole manual can be viewed here: https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-rebase.html

The specific configuration components that i think are most valuable are the "--onto" paired with configurable upstream and branch. This would allow more complex rebasing to take place.
fields.summary: More configuration options for doing a rebase

fields.description:
I use dark Gmail, dark IntelliJ IDEA, dark browser, everything is dark except SourceTree.

The white user interface kills my eyes. Can we have an option for a dark theme?
fields.summary: Implement a dark theme/skin

fields.summary: SourceTree fails to start

fields.description:
Since SourceTree already has Mercurial and git support, I'm hoping it would be relatively low-hanging fruit to add explicit codeplex support (for hg and git - any projects using TFS as their source control wouldn't be supported, or at least I'm not requesting that :)

I was contributing to a codeplex project today that uses Mercurial for source control, and SourceTree worked with it fine as a 'normal' Mercurial repository, but when trying to create the pull request, it was asking me to manually set up the new remote.  Since codeplex puts forks as underneath the project (instead of a peer, like github), the pull request process could have already know the 'upstream' and made it a bit easier.

It could also surface things like creating forks under projects, and likely lots of other things, but just getting it to 'know about' codeplex is definitely the first step. :)

Thanks!!
fields.summary: add support for codeplex (hg and git)

fields.description:
When modifying the index (add / remove files in the various main views / commit dialog, after this completes the size of the columns shown is resized to the default. This is annoying. If I've resized columns, it is to see particular information about the files that are in the index / work area.

Expected behaviour: do not reset column sizes when modifying the index.
fields.summary: Bug: columns should not resize after modifying index

fields.description: When changing the index, ST always flicks up the adding files / unstaging files dialog. This is annoying as it's not generally up for long enough to read / do anything about, and it takes away the focus from what I was working on (e.g. which files are in the index, commit message etc.) Perhaps only show this if the wait time is beyond a certain threshold?
fields.summary: Feature / Bug: Please get rid of the hard refresh when adding / changing the index

fields.description:
I use a mac with parallels running a vm to to .Net work. Hence my keyboard shortcuts on each system are a little inconsistent and I often hit Alt+left/Right to move over words instead of Ctrl+Left/Right.
When I do this on the commit dialog in the message section, the underlying screen is affected. One of the columns in the listbox under the screen seems to be being adjusted.
Expected behaviour - do nothing instead of this behaviour.
fields.summary: Alt + left / right on commit dialog affects the underlying screen

fields.description: Often I'll click the add all button (double up arrows) on the commit dialog and then click the commit button (or press Ctrl+Enter). If you do this fast enough, sometimes sourcetree has not yet seen the files that I just added and so I get a message saying that I need to add files to the index before committing. This is annoying.
fields.summary: Lag between some actions (add all then commit on the commit dialog)

fields.description:
Often it's nice to just use the keyboard, but still see the results of the actions (hence using ST instead of just the command line).
It would be nice if the add all button (double arrows) on the main screen and on the commit dialog had associated keyboard shortcuts.
fields.summary: Add All menu option should work inside commit dialog

fields.description:
In a git repo with some ignored files change to the ignored files view and enter a search keyword (e.g. in my case I want to add all the Nuget packages folder files to the repo, but some of them get .gitignored, so I enter packages).
The view changes to show only those files. Click add all (the double up arrow) and then change to the log/history view.

Expected: just the files that were shown in the filtered view (e.g. those files in the packages folder) are added to the git index.

Actual: all the files that were ignored are added to the git index.
fields.summary: Bug: Add all files button when showing filtered view should only add files shown in view

fields.description:
I had just stashed some changes and pulled from a remote repo when the crash dialog appeared, sorry no further info that I can think of.

logfile attached

Good luck!
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashed while pulling from origin

fields.description: After creating a new branch in the Source Tree UI the branch is created successfully but the list of branches does not refresh to show the new branch.
fields.summary: After creating a new branch the list of branches is not refreshed

fields.description: It would be really useful to have the ability to sort the repositories list alphanumerically instead of having to keep hunting for the repo I need when I have a lot of repositories inside of Source Tree.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to sort the repositories list

fields.description:
Searching for a tag in the history would be very useful.

If the repo has hundreds of tags (as ours does) using the tag list isn't very efficient. It would be preferable to simple search for it.
fields.summary: Search screen should search Git tags as well as commit messages, file changes and authors

fields.description:
Support pushing only some commits using the syntax:

git push <remote> <commit SHA>:<remote_branch>
fields.summary: Push only some commits

fields.description: It will be beneficial to see actual name of the branch you are trying to merge into.
fields.summary: Merge branch into "current branch". Replace with current branch name.

fields.description:
After cloning a repository, we always have to instruct developers to intiialise their local repo with the GitFlow workflow by pressing the GitFlow button.

Might be a nice touch if there was a post clone option in the clone dialog to automatically initialise the repository with the GitFlow workflow.  I guess it would not prompt for the defaults in this instance and just use them.
fields.summary: Ability to automatically initialise cloned repository with GitFlow workflow

fields.description:
Today, we have discovered what caused a merge with a tag in our commit history which was not expected for one of the developers.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create hotfix branch JIRA-45
2. Commit to branch
3. Finish hotfix branch
4. Create new hotfix branch with the same name
5. Commit to the branch
6. Finish the hotfix branch

This will cause Sourcetree to merge the previous tag instead of the branch in and then delete the branch, in this situation what instead I believe should happen is a warning should be shown about the same name for a pre-existing branch/tag which prevents this action from being
fields.summary: Git commands not specific enough - Finishing hotfix issue

fields.description:
Every second line in the list of commits appears blank. The lines that do appear seem to also have an undesired UI.

This issue is constant, from when the application is started to when it is closed. Selecting an invisible item reveals the commit description text. Selecting one of the items that is highlighted blue with description text in white presents no visible change in list of commits (although it updates the 3 boxes below to data pertaining to the newly selected commit).

One image is with no item selected. The image with 3 blue highlighted items in a row has the middle row, of the three items that are highlighted blue, selected.
fields.summary: Lines in the list of commits appear blank
Authentication failed for Stash

fields.description: it becomes difficult to click the symbols by mouse.
fields.summary: SourceTree cannot display (+) correctly with Windows 7 Classical

fields.description:
"Terminal" shows bash.exe in console window.
But Windows's console window is hard to use, so I want to use another console window, such as ckw-mod(https://github.com/ckw-mod/ckw-mod), Console(http://sourceforge.net/projects/console/).

I want to customize command line that executed by pressing "Terminl" button in Preference.
fields.summary: Adding config option of command line for "Terminal"

fields.description:
Keyboard selection of files in the Log History and File Status are too slow, Log History even more than File Status.

To reproduce:

0. Make sure you have a lot of items in the Log History or File Status
1. Hold down the shift key
2. Click any file item in the Log History or File Status
3. Hold down the up or down arrow key for a while
4. Observe the selection to add files in batches of about a dozen (depending on machine speed): inbetween those batches lots of CPU is used on painting.
fields.summary: Keyboard selection of files in the Log History and File Status are too slow

fields.description:
It is currently impossible to type any non latin characters into the description field.
It just does not allow to type any alt+something character.
fields.summary: Unable to typy polish characters into the description field

fields.description:
See attached images (boxes are my own addition).

The topic branch's parent is the commit in the line above (a5fea), but the graph is drawing the parent line all the way past any commit in the history so that there is no parent commit on the line.  It just stops at the bottom.

Its correct if change the drop down to "Current Branch"

With every other commit the graph is correct.
fields.summary: Graph shows incorrect parent of commit in 'All Branches'

fields.description:
Show Log has an "External Diff" button, but no context-menu item or Ctrl-D shortcut for that

I've not tried the Git module on this yet.
fields.summary: Show Log has an "External Diff" button, but no context-menu item or Ctrl-D shortcut for that

fields.description:
Ever since (at least 1.0.6) the SourceTree update process fails every single time there is an update, unless I manually intervene.

When running the update (initiated from within SourceTree), this will be my process layout:

!http://i.imgur.com/ImHM41b.png!

Update will then complain that SourceTree is still running and that it should be closed, fine.

!http://i.imgur.com/VHh1Ikf.png!

And here is the major issue with it, it doesn't close the pageant child process:

!http://i.imgur.com/NzYj7u6.png!

Which then later leads to the inability to replace the pageant file:

!http://i.imgur.com/1VvAT69.png!

When I ignore this issue, I'll end up with the very misleading error message:

!http://i.imgur.com/JT4PERL.png!
fields.summary: Update process always failing due to SSH agent

fields.description:
Error message when opening hosted repository list.

"The following errors were encountered:   Collection was modified; enumeration operation may not execute."
fields.summary: Collection was modified; enumeration operation may not execute   in Hosted Repo list.

fields.description:
We are running a locally hosted Stash enterprise server (2.7.2) and for some users when they try and add it as a hosted repository it Sourcetree complains that the password being entered is wrong.   No amount of fiddling and removing cached passwords fixes this.   

For other users, they have no problem at all.    Tried all sorts, in the end a totall uninstall and deleting of the application data followed by a reinstall was the only was to get it accepting the password and add the server.

This affects about 1 in 4 of our users, but I can't see any pattern.
fields.summary: Added Stash hosting accounts fails for some users with wrong password

fields.description:
I started using git with SoureTree a week ago. I installed SourceTree in all my computer : My Macbook Pro (running Lion), My Desktop and My Laptop  (Running Windows 7 Pro 64bit). 
SourceTree is amazing graph tool for GIt and  it was running great on my Macbook and Laptop. But on my Desktop, The graph ( that shows log/history commit ) was not working correctly. 
As normal, font in that graph display with black color and grid view between each line. But on my Desktop, it goes with grid view, but font are white and the background are blue/white (as show in screen-1.png), line only show if i selected it.I tried to remove then reinstall SourceTree , or reinstall .NET frameworks but could not solve the problem. Could you guy help me please ? It really disgusting when I could not view the graph clearly :( 

PS : About my Desktop enviroments, I hope that helps :
Windows 7 64bit
Ruby 1.9.3, XAMPP 1.7.7.NE., NodeJS
.NET Frameworks 4.5
Dropbox2.0.26, Skydrive latest,
Tortoise SVN 1.8.1, Git 1.8.4 Preveiw 20130916,
Microsoft Office 2010, Libre Office Latest
fields.summary: Graph view in Log/History not display if not selected

fields.description:
Some of the files have modified mode from 100755->100644 (cygwin git used to manage this repository). When I try to "Discard File" (shouldn't that be "Discard changes (to file)"?) , I get a confirmation dialog, but nothing happens when I press ok (nor when I press cancel). These supposed changes prevents me from merging.

Just digged a bit further, and neither tortoisegit or cygwin git reported these file mode changes even after setting filemode in git config to false. Git merge in cygwin worked without problems. Unfortunately I forgot to check what the mode actually was before pulling (only realized that now).
fields.summary: filemode/discard problem

fields.description:
Currently the SourceTree browser allows you to sort on filename or path, but not on filetype.

Sorting on filetype is a welcomed feature, for instance to skip checking in a bunch of .res files for which you know the changes are moot.
fields.summary: Add ability to sort files by file type

fields.description:
if i view a set of differences and select multiple files and there are lots of files and/or lots of differences such that they exceed the limits in the settings, then there is no message to tell me i've exceeded a limit - it just claims there are no differences beyond that point.  (it shows the files with a green tick icon and the text "Unmodified file".)

a warning message would be good, possibly with a link to take you to the settings and/or a button which will auto-boost the settings to whatever is needed for the current diff (or at least display what numbers i need to achieve that).

also i think the default values are a bit low.  might it be better to have the defaults as 'unlimited' and add a 'cancel' button for diff actions ... and perhaps find some way to generate a progress bar on the diff?  maybe you can run the diff as a separate diff per file (ooh, in parallel for multi-core goodness!) and track progress through the list of files?
fields.summary: diff limits cause 'Unmodified file' rather than 'File not checked'

fields.description: each time i update the application (thanks for the steady stream of updates - that's really good :-)) my taskbar launcher stops working and i have to add it again from the start menu.
fields.summary: application update breaks shortcuts

fields.description: Would it be possible to add a column for the amended date in the changes lists.
fields.summary: Add column for date in file status lists.

fields.description: Please could you add ability to ignore case when viewing differences (prior to staging changes).
fields.summary: Ignore Case option for DIFF View
Crash when I open log tab (it was empty repository)

fields.description:
Issue occurs a few seconds after startup of the app. app appears to hang the computer after starting. No signs of ST starting up during the hanging.

Here is the stack trace from the windows event log:
{noformat}
Application: SourceTree.exe
Framework Version: v4.0.30319
Description: The process was terminated due to an unhandled exception.
Exception Info: System.Configuration.ConfigurationErrorsException
Stack:
   at System.Configuration.BaseConfigurationRecord.GetSectionRecursive(System.String, Boolean, Boolean, Boolean, Boolean, System.Object ByRef, System.Object ByRef)
   at System.Configuration.BaseConfigurationRecord.GetSection(System.String)
   at System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager.GetSection(System.String)
   at System.Configuration.ClientSettingsStore.ReadSettings(System.String, Boolean)
   at System.Configuration.LocalFileSettingsProvider.GetPropertyValues(System.Configuration.SettingsContext, System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyCollection)
   at System.Configuration.SettingsBase.GetPropertiesFromProvider(System.Configuration.SettingsProvider)
   at System.Configuration.SettingsBase.GetPropertyValueByName(System.String)
   at System.Configuration.SettingsBase.get_Item(System.String)
   at System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.GetPropertyValue(System.String)
   at System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.get_Item(System.String)
   at SourceTree.App..ctor()
   at SourceTree.App.Main()
{noformat}
fields.summary: ConfigurationErrorsException crash on startup

fields.description:
If you use a Stash server with a self-signed certificate the error that results isn't obvious, it masquerades as a login error during the auth check in the Hosted Repositories accounts setup. 

We should hook into the SSL cert validation process to detect this error and deal with it more elegantly:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/708210/how-to-use-http-get-request-in-c-sharp-with-ssl-protocol-violation
fields.summary: Better feedback on REST API SSL cert validation error (self signed)

fields.description: I like to copy some lines out from the diff preview (e.g. to use my changelog notes as commit message)
fields.summary: Allow copy of selected line(s) in diff

fields.description:
Git TFS is an extension to git that allows interacting with TFS using git as a pretty decent facade. It would be nice if sourcetree enabled support for commands that hook onto the git command.
In particular I run the following commands regularly (multiple times a day):
* git tfs fetch (fetches tfs changes into a tag named tfs/default)
* git tfs rcheckin (replays the current branch onto tfs/default and submits each replayed commit to TFS. updates the commit message to link to a changeset ID in TFS).
fields.summary: Support git tfs commands
